factoid: Schubert is the colonel of the Pávlograd Hussars.
Schubert is dining with us today.
Schubert has been on leave here.
Schubert is taking Nicholas back with him.
The count said that it cannot be helped.
The count shrugged his shoulders and spoke playfully about a matter that distressed him.
Nicholas told the count that if the count does not wish to let him go, Nicholas will stay.
Nicholas said that Nicholas knows he is useless anywhere except in the army.
Nicholas said that Nicholas is not a diplomat or a government clerk.
Nicholas said that Nicholas does not know how to hide what Nicholas feels.
While speaking, Nicholas glanced flirtatiously at Sónya and at the young lady visitor.
The little kitten was feasting her eyes on Nicholas.
The kitten seemed ready to start her gambols again and display her kittenish nature.
The old count said, "All right, all right!".
The old count said that Nicholas always flares up.
The old count said that Buonaparte has turned all their heads.
The old count said that everyone thinks of how Buonaparte rose from an ensign to Emperor.
The old count said, "Well, well, God grant it.".
The elders began talking about Bonaparte.
Julie Karágina turned to young Rostóv.
Julie Karágina said that it was a pity Rostóv was not at the Arkhárovs’ on Thursday.
Julie Karágina said that the event was dull without Rostóv.
Julie Karágina gave Rostóv a tender smile.
The young man was flattered and sat down nearer to Julie.
The young man smiled coquettishly and engaged Julie in a confidential conversation.
The young man's involuntary smile stabbed the heart of Sónya.
Sónya blushed and smiled unnaturally.
The young man glanced around at Sónya.
Sónya gave the young man a passionately angry glance.
Sónya hardly restrained her tears and maintained an artificial smile.
Sónya got up and left the room.
Nicholas’ animation vanished.
Nicholas waited for the first pause in the conversation.
Nicholas left the room with a distressed face to find Sónya.
Anna Mikháylovna pointed to Nicholas as he went out.
Anna Mikháylovna said that all these young people wear their hearts on their sleeves.
Anna Mikháylovna added, "Cousinage—dangereux voisinage.".
Cousinhood is a dangerous neighborhood.
The countess said yes when the brightness that these young people had brought into the room had vanished.
The countess said that the countess has always imagined that children have no secrets from her.
The countess said that the countess has always been her children's friend and had their full confidence.
The countess said that the countess knows she will always be her daughters' first confidante.
The countess said that if Nicholas, with his impulsive nature, gets into mischief, Nicholas will never be like those Petersburg young men.
The count said that the young men are splendid youngsters.
The count said that the young man wants to be a hussar.
The visitor said that the younger girl is a charming creature.
The visitor said that the younger girl is a little volcano.
The count said that the younger girl is a regular volcano.
The count said that the younger girl takes after the count.
The count said that the younger girl has a voice.
The count said that the younger girl will be a singer, a second Salomoni.
The count said that the count has engaged an Italian to give her lessons.
The visitor said that the younger girl is too young to train her voice.
The count replied that the younger girl is not too young.
The count said that mothers used to be married at twelve or thirteen.
